p: Coronaviruses are not the only viruses associated with neurological complications. Zika virus is an arbovirus transmitted mainly by mosquitos of Aedes species. During the recent outbreak due to Zika virus, serious neurological complications were observed, including microcephaly, Guillain-Barr√© syndrome (GBS), and eye infections [ 16]. Less frequently reported neurological complications include encephalitis/meningoencephalitis, acute disseminated encephalomyelitis, myelitis, cerebrovascular diseases (ischemic infarction and vasculopathy), seizures and encephalopathy, sensory polyneuropathy, and neuronopathy [ 17].
